intro: Androsace articulata, commonly known as the jointed rock jasmine, is a low-growing perennial plant native to alpine regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its succulent, often hairy leaves and small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant’s stems are segmented, giving it the common name "jointed," and it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. Androsace articulata is often found in mountain meadows and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and resilient member of alpine flora.
